caption:
Test seats = empowerment, not shame. A lot of people think they’re embarrassing, but they’re actually one of the most helpful tools at any theme park—including Walt Disney World and Universal Studios. Test seats let you see what works for your body before you wait in line, helping you avoid stress, not cause it. No surprises. No awkward moments. Just peace of mind.

At Disney, the most used test seats are for Flight of Passage in Animal Kingdom and Tron Lightcycle Run in Magic Kingdom. Both rides have unique seating that can be tricky for some guests, so testing ahead of time can save you time and stress.

They’re made for you—use them. It’s not about judgment. It’s about feeling confident and comfortable so you can enjoy your day without worry. Your experience matters, and you deserve to ride with confidence—whether you're visiting Disney or Universal.

Want more tips to help you feel empowered at theme parks? Follow for plus-size friendly ride checks, honest advice, and real talk that puts your comfort first.

📍Magic Kingdom,  Epcot Center,  Disney's Animal Kingdom,  Walt Disney World,  Orlando Florida
